intro: Hoya odorata subsp. antoinsensis, commonly known as the Antoin's wax plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asclepiadaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, white bloom. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming during the warmer months. It is a popular houseplant due to its low maintenance and ability to thrive in indirect light. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a sought-after specimen among plant enthusiasts.
